result.post: viremia during coinfection. DISCUSSION NHPs are often used as

result.pre: limited. Here, we studied how preexisting SIV infection influences subsequent
result.post: infection. We find that the type I IFN responses

result.pre: I IFN responses elicited in SIV-infected RMs correlates with reduced
result.post: replication, that these coinfected animals mount inferior humoral responses

result.pre: humoral responses to ZIKV, and that these animals have delayed
result.post: clearance. A recent study, using a small cohort of

result.pre: simian-human immunodeficiency virus (SHIV)- and SIV-infected RMs also found that
result.post: viremia was uncharacteristically low during coinfection; however, the authors

result.pre: that SHIV/SIV infections did not dramatically influence the course of
result.post: infection (64). This small study of only 4 Asian
